items.title: Breaking: Former High Court justice to lead Bondi royal commission
items.description: A national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack will be called by Anthony Albanese who is expected to reverse his position after weeks of pressure to establish the inquiry.

items.title: 'Let's be clear, it's too high': RBA deputy downplays easing inflation
items.description: The deputy governor of the Reserve Bank Andrew Hauser confirms the news mortgage borrowers would not have wanted to hear — interest rates are highly unlikely to head lower anytime soon.

items.title: Live: Australia won't escape 'extreme' financial markets consequences: Hauser
items.description: ABC News has an exclusive interview with RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser, who says he has a message that people may not want to hear.

items.title: Live: Fire-fuelled thunderstorms form in north-east Victoria as residents urged to leave
items.description: A heatwave stretching across southern Australia is in its second day, with properties feared lost in an out-of-control bushfire in central Victoria.

items.title: US seizes more tankers as it lays out three-phase plan for Venezuela
items.description: Russia says one of the Venezuela-linked tankers is "our vessel" and demands the quick release of its citizens, as the US pledges to continue seizing ships and keep the pressure on Venezuela's interim leaders.

items.title: Why Trump's threat to Greenland hinges on NATO's Article 5
items.description: Donald Trump has made it clear he's departing from decades of US foreign policy norms and once-close allies are now questioning what it could mean for them.

items.title: Australia underlines its dominance to write its own Ashes story
items.description: A 4-1 scoreline can leave no doubt, this has been an Ashes summer of dominance for a resilient Australian side and tour of errors and mismanagement for England.

items.title: China has given Latin America billions. That will not save Maduro
items.description: Despite being one of the strongest critics of Donald Trump's move to capture Nicolás Maduro, Beijing has not moved beyond condemnation of Washington.

items.title: Palestinian Australian author dropped from writers' festival after Bondi
items.description: Dr Randa Abdel-Fattah has been dropped from the Adelaide Writers' Week line-up by the Adelaide Festival Board, citing the festival's role in "promoting community cohesion".

items.title: 'I killed old mate': Prisoner confesses to killing 'child molester' inmate
items.description: Isaac James Martin, 31, says he has not "bothered" to get legal representation, telling a Brisbane court he "killed old mate because he's a child molester".

items.title: 13yo boys survive crash when car splits during police chase
items.description: The teenagers have been taken from Lithgow to a Sydney hospital after a pursuit began on the Great Western Highway.

items.title: Legal observers keep watch as ICE patrols the streets. Now one of them is dead
items.description: As Donald Trump's immigration crackdown escalates in Minneapolis, networks of local residents patrol the streets too, warning of incoming ICE raids, documenting what happens and offering legal advice to those targeted.

items.title: Ex-Test cricketer Martyn returns home after waking from induced coma
items.description: Adam Gilchrist says his former Australia teammate Damien Martyn has been released from a Gold Coast hospital.

items.title: Police lay further charges over Melbourne boys' stabbing deaths
items.description: Homicide detectives lay further murder charges over the high-profile deaths of 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer suburbs last September.

items.title: Nick Reiner's high-profile lawyer quits as public defenders take over
items.description: Lawyer Alan Jackson gave no reason for quitting but says that under California law, his client is definitely not guilty of murdering his parents, Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner.

items.title: Two boaties pulled a man from the sea. He only ever said four words.
items.description: The "swift action" of members of the public has been praised in the rescue of a 74-year-old man who became separated from his boat.

items.title: Boom time for active holiday tours drawing travellers with 'young energy'
items.description: There is no lounging by the pool for these travellers, who are spending a week swimming the remote waters of the Turkish Lycian coast.

items.title: The two biggest renovation mistakes, according to this design show host
items.description: We chat with inimitable interior designer Yasmine Ghoniem ahead of Grand Designs Transformations series two to learn how she made it, her hot design takes, and what to expect from this season.

items.title: Australia's largest car festival revs into action amid soaring temperatures
items.description: Australia’s biggest car festival roars to life amid a scorching heatwave, thrill-seeking crowds and strict policing.

items.title: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know
items.description: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

items.title: How the 'American in Australia' trend reveals something about us and them
items.description: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

items.title: Far North Queensland braces for a deluge of rain and possible cyclone
items.description: A tropical low has been declared over the Coral Sea and it is expected to move towards the Far North Queensland coast over the next few days. The bureau said there is a moderate chance it could develop into a tropical cyclone.

items.title: 'Bunch of cash': The big little fundraiser causing problems for the NSW premier
items.description: A decade-old Labor fundraiser at the centre of allegations that NSW Premier Chris Minns conspired to evade a state donations law was reported at the time as a much bigger event than official records suggest, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: Huge 4.9m-long crocodile pulled from NT creek that feeds popular waterfall
items.description: Rangers in the Northern Territory have caught an average of a crocodile per day in the first week of 2026, including one measuring 4.9 metres pulled from waters near a popular swimming spot.

items.title: Neale has Lions' 'blessing' if he wants to return to Perth after 2026 season
items.description: The Brisbane Lions will not stand in the way of Lachie Neale if the club's former co-captain chooses to return to Perth at the end of the season.
